Has anyone else experienced this type of thing?  I'm currently working
on a=
 project in which I had to use JACOB (See here FMI:
http://groups.yahoo.com=
/group/jacob-project/) to access a COM object
via Java.  I got my class wor=
king correctly and was quite happy.  

However, once I tried to write a JUn=
it test for it, it mysteriously
ceased working.  After spending about a day=
 and a half on the issue we
tried, in desperation, moving the whole shebang=
 to another developer's
environment wherein it worked beautifully.

That de=
veloper was then tasked with writing the JUnit test, but before
he could do=
 so he had to apply the JUnit JAR files to his Eclipse
environment.  Immedi=
ately the COM accessing class failed once more.

Curious, we uninstalled th=
e JUnit JAR from my environment and lo and
behold, the class began working =
again.

So, obviously there is some conflict between JUnit and JACOB. I'm
u=
sing JUnit 3.8.1 and JACOB 1.8.  Any help or assistance would be
greatly ap=
preciated.

JV
